note.p: Career: Began as a painter and engraver, with an interest in mathematics; became Professor of Mathematics, Ecole militaire, Paris; established an observatory at the Ecole Militaire (1769); lived at the Royal Observatory (from 1770); edited "Connaissance des temps"; Vice director of Academy (1791) and Director (1792)
Notes: Note on certificate: 'Ballotted for and rejected April 3 1788'
